Yes, there are several famous Renaissance art pieces that depict Clio. Some examples include:

1. The Muses (1530) by Raphael - This fresco painting in the Vatican Palace in Rome features Clio, along with the other eight Muses, seated together with Apollo.

2. The Ceiling of the Stanza della Segnatura (1508-1511) by Raphael - This fresco painting in the Vatican Palace in Rome depicts Clio as one of four allegorical figures representing the themes of Theology, Philosophy, Poetry, and Law.

3. Triumph of Fame (1490-1492) by Andrea Mantegna - This painting in the Louvre Museum in Paris depicts Clio riding a chariot and holding a trumpet, with other Muses and personifications of the arts and sciences surrounding her.

4. Triumph of Bacchus and Ariadne (c. 1522) by Titian - This painting in the National Gallery in London depicts Clio, along with the other Muses, attending the wedding of Bacchus and Ariadne.
